divs: sighting detailsi along with seven other adult family members observed an amber, glowing light in the sky. unbeknownst to us, the fireworks display we were waiting on had been cancelled due to rain that ended around 21:00. as we waited, and watched to the south for the show to begin, we observed this object just appear out of no where at altitude. i would estimate that the object was travelling on an estimated course of 310 - 320 deg. from the south at a speed of 40 -50 kts. altitude could be estimated at 2k - 3k feet. what little twilight remained suggested that the wind was calm from the east with maybe 40% broken clouds. interstingly, we could hear others on the lake making the same observation. as the object came closer, the amber light appeared to flicker, and it's possible that it had more than just one light. the object displayed no nav, beacon or landing\taxi lights and made no sound as it approached and passed. after it passed overhead, it continued for a short distance then slowly turned west (maybe to 290 deg.) until it disappeared behind some clouds. strange. best explained as a balloon, comical paraglider or a really quiet helo from grissom afb? really strange? this happened again approximately 10-12 minutes later. same course, altitude, speed, etc. a replay of sorts. again? yes! another 10-12 minutes later, same as before. only notable difference was that the object turned earlier than before on the final pass. we all shrugged and joked that we had all witnessed our first ufo. we are all skeptical, but very curious for an explanation. i am sure that dozens of others on the lake observed this display. what better time to announce your presence than the only night of the year when so many are watching the sky?
Summary: Observed amber, glowing light move precisely across the sky and disappear three times in 35 minutes.
